thread.title: TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests
thread.title_full: TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests

title: TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests TCU senior defensive end Mike Tuaua and freshman receiver Andre Petties-Wilson have been reinstated and will be eligible to play against Texas on Saturday Post to Facebook TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests TCU senior defensive end Mike Tuaua and freshman receiver Andre Petties-Wilson have been reinstated and will be eligible to play against Texas on Saturday   KHOU.com: http://on.khou.com/1FJDALz   Join the Conversation To   TCU players back after missing 3 games following arrests Associated Press 7:04 p.m. CDT October 1, 2015 TCU senior defensive end Mike Tuaua and freshman receiver Andre Petties-Wilson have been reinstated and will be eligible to play against Texas on Saturday Aug 30, 2014; Fort Worth, TX, USA; TCU Horned Frogs defensive end Mike Tuaua (93) poses for a photo after the game against the Samford Bulldogs at Amon G. Carter Stadium. Tuaua has two sacks and forces two fumbles. The Horned Frogs defeated the Bulldogs 48-14. Mandatory Credit: Jerome Miron-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Jerome Miron, Jerome Miron-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) - TCU senior defensive end Mike Tuaua and freshman receiver Andre Petties-Wilson have been reinstated and will be eligible to play against Texas on Saturday. 
The players were arrested last week on charges of robbery-bodily injury after another TCU student told Fort Worth police investigators that the players stole a case of beer while attacking him and his friends. 
The incident happened Sept. 4, a day after the fourth-ranked Horned Frogs beat Minnesota in their season opener. Tuaua and Petties-Wilson played against the Golden Gophers but missed the past three games. 
Coach Gary Patterson said the players had "gone through the judicial process," although a Fort Worth police spokesman said the case hasn't been forwarded to Tarrant County prosecutors. 
Tuaua played all 12 games with five starts last season.
